comments.body:
Yes we need that

please add it
True

I totally agree, looting and the looting system needs a rework. For example how you find loot is completely based on your weared power level, this means that if you wanna use items you like you need to equip trash item which happend to have highest power level before a load screen and then after that you can switch back to your preferable gear. Tedious and stupid.

Unique items needs a rework too, they need to be more unique than their normal counter part. I found the Whirlwind double axe for example, and it only had a crappy Shockwave enchantment, what if it had a lvl 3 Swirling plus a 25% faster attack speed bonus? That would make it certainly alot better and fit the name "Whirlwind" too! Also give unique weapons little bit more base damage than the normal versions of them too.

Also I feel that most unique items should have a totally unique bonus, maybe a Cursed Axe would have a unique bonus that increases the % chance of all enchantments by 30% or another item that doubles all effect durations, things like that would be really cool and fun but also rewarding to find.

As a balance they could make these weapons rarer to find if needed.

Also the enchantment "Looting" Should make so items has higher chance to drop aswell like in regular minecraft, as it is now it's pretty useless and I doubt anyone uses it.

I have put quite a lot of hours into Borderlands 3, and farming gear there was fun. I sometimes ran bored, but it went over again because I knew all the fun things I could do in that game.

But for Minecraft Dungeons it's a real annoyance. I have run bored of the game honestly. For the last week or so I was first farming for a Renegade armor with double cooldown, but then switch to get battlerobe with double cooldown, but I have gotten none so far. I have probably gotten a few hundred battle robes so far that I have just trashed.

Even though they shouldn't make farming too easily rewarding, they really should improve how it is now. A big mistake in looting games is to make the stuff people are looking for too hard and tedious to get, or you end up bored like me. All I want is to get what I have been farming for days and have some fun with it, but even that is too much to ask for.

An endgame something like Diablo's Rift system, or POE's maps would be good. Some kind of system with random levels with random enemies and drops in them, which you can continue through infinitely, with endlessly increasing difficulty and rewards, and along with that, something in place for the player to become stronger with the endlessly increasing difficulty, like Diablo 3 has legendary gems, and more powerful variants of items you normally get.

This. This is what I would love to see.

Amazing idea! I hope it gets added, it would make questing more fun.

The NPC could be in the Squid Coast Village (Repaired). I feel like your idea and:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360067840271-Squid-Coast-Village-at-Camp 

This Idea would work well together in game.
This would make the game so much more immersive! YEssss!

I believe adding a quest system into the game would greatly lengthen the play experience for certain players. I find myself losing interest after I've obtained Enchanted armor weapons and have beaten the Ender Dragon and Wither boss I quickly lose interest in playing. My idea was add Quest givers to The Villages that give daily Quests. Some examples of quest would be collect 10 logs 10 Oak planks and 30 Oak fences for a quest turn in which would result in a reward of money or items. A follow-up Quest you could help him build the structure he wants to build with the materials you provided for him. Another idea is generate Villages that are damaged and give quests that aren't dailies available to the player were you need to rebuild this town that was attacked by pillagers. Through a series of quests you rebuild individual buildings and once the whole questline is complete the town will be rebuilt. This would not be an example of a repeatable daily but another idea were questing could go. With infinite World Generation you would never run out of quests to do. I think the rewards of just getting emeralds and things of that nature would get boring over time so maybe implement new items in game that are costly and offer some type of benefit to the player like the beacon does. I have lots of great ideas that could go into this and Hope the developers see this post!
I Think This Would Be Awesome!!

I would like to see a quest not revolving around the Arch-illager but things like the raid from Minecraft, but like example: "a redstone golem is attacking the village" not save the village from pillagers like Minecraft.
This gonna be cool for minecraft and more fun to play with, i'm sure they gonna add it from the fututre updates

This sounds great but maybe a warden boss that has been corrupted by the shard and amethyst daggers and instead of an archaeologist pickaxe maybe a archaeologist brush which is an artefact that upon use it will summon some sort of item to help you (like the new brushes from 1.17) and instead of a skulk pickaxe you could get a skulk trap that upon use will be placed on the ground and look like 1 skulk sensor with 4 iron doors on each side so that when you step the skulk sensor will activate triggering the trap doors sending vibrations tricking anything that relies on vibrations into thinking your where the skulk trap is however if you attack that any mobs tricked by it the mob will head to wherever the attack is coming from until it reaches where it the attack is coming from and then will attack however if the attack stops and it doesn't hit anything then it then it will head go to the trap again (the trap will only send vibrations when you are doing anything to cause vibrations (you also must be within range of it to detect vibrations same as anything else that uses vibrations)).
I love your idea!
I had an idea where the first level for the End DLC can have the new Cave types in it and have the stronghold at the very end.

Your first level is a cave level. Then a deepslate cave and mineshaft. In the mineshaft there's a hidden level, the lush cave and in the deepslate cave are deepdark and hidden dripstone caves. Maybe an auquifer level with hidden depths mechanics. In the deepdark 1/3 of the way in, the warden will spawn and you'll have to RUN. Please bring back mine carts, which I had an idea for. Empty minecarts do less damage and are faster. Chest mine carts are on a loop and could be an alternative for piggy banks. Lots of minecarts and cave spider spawners in the mineshaft level please. We need more cave spiders, spawners and slimes. And what's minecraft DUNGEONS without DUNGEONS?
I thought of it myself also. We need minecraft dungeons in vr.
This is something Ive been wanting since day one. My son likes to look at everything he picks up mid game, and I can't see what is killing me as he salveges stuff.

Already planned.

üåê Cross Platform Multiplayer
Cross platform multiplayer has not been implemented yet.
It is on Mojang‚Äôs to do list.
No information regarding a release time has been announced.
Our goal is to let everyone play together regardless of platform, and we‚Äôre looking forward to enabling cross-platform play in a future free game update
FAQ at Official Discord
I see some folks asking about crossplay. It's still on the way and has not been forgotten! It's a big technical undertaking and won't make it for Creeping Winter but the team is making good progress on it.
Gartzke at Official Discord
Same here. I have it on PC, and my friend has it on Nintendo Switch. We looked it up and it said that it isn't cross-platform... plz fix
I agree, because i have a Nintendo Switch and my friend has a Xbox One. And we constantly play games together.
How do u friend someone? I‚Äôm a bit cunfused because I‚Äôm 8 and I have Nintendo switch Minecraft dungeons and my friend has a Xbox one and I want to play Minecraft dungeons with him

Power lvl doesn't mean you got a efficent and speedy character at killing and moving. I don't think increasing the power lvl too often would be a good thing. It would be really hard to follow the power lvl increase for most people, feeling like the gear they got would be weak within a short period of time. I mean from your point of view winthin the next week you would be power lvl 111-112 and ask for another power lvl increase.

That being said I don't mind having new dungeon(s), not too short though because it's boring.

I would rather make the current maps better by:

1. Making obsidian chest more random with a 100% chance to spawn to promote exploration.

2. Add a Magic Find bar that fill up as you kill enemies to increase your magic find against the end boss of the map. That would be better for the health of the game instead of seeing people rushing chests and bosses without killing anything for the sake of efficiency. 

3. Adding a way to start a map with a "Normal start" and a "Start with an random affix(es)" which would affect the current map difficulty and reward.

4. Adding a vendor that "could" rarely spawn  winthin the map at random location(s) selling a few legendaries in exchange of emeralds. That also would promote exploration of the map instead of seeing people rushing the end of the map.

5. More events could be added to promote killing and exploration in the future. For exemple, an unique pack of monsters or unique boss that spawn randomly (but rarely) in the map.
That actually sounds really cool I was also thinking similar like this endless waves of mobs with loot, nice idea!

This is cool! It would be like it starts out really easy, but every level gets harder and harder until at level 100 you‚Äôre fighting waves of Heart of Enders and they‚Äôre dropping level 209 Diamond Swords.

there would be no limit to how many bosses in a level.

it would be on an island to the east of the mainland.

it would sort of have eastern architecture too, to give you something a bit different from the other areas in the game.
This sounds EPIC!
You called it
Diego
Yeah I agree, a trident would be pretty awesome, but I think that you should have explained more on how the throwing mechanic should work.
If there is an expansion pass, maybe this would be in one of the expansions.  Like an underwater themed expansion.(The oceans of the Elder guardian)
Maybe the trident could be the only multi-weapon, so you can equip it in the melee or ranged slot.
yes, just having a small salvage undo button after completing is good but 5 minutes too strong olny mabye 5 seconds while in a match and 10 while at camp.
Maybe add a salvage bin where the items you salvage go and you need to empty it to completly destroy them. You could also unsavage items from there.
And he could two shot you with quadruple protection 3, 260 power, armor, +guarding strike +35% damage reduction just like in minecraft!
I agree. It should appear in a deep dark city dlc.
Yes Minecraft dungeons warden and deepdark city
Definitely
Good Idea, I like seeing posts with clear ideas rather than the two sentences demanding a new in game feature. lol.

I agree. Sometimes I don't feel like having to deal with Raid captains, but still want to find all the chests and secrets on a level. It's a bit like we get punished for having completed a mission already.
But if you want a way to defeat them quickly, get a torment quiver and a bow with Dynamo. Get some dynamo stacks and enough souls for the soul quiver, and you can one-shot the raid captains.

Raid captains should honestly be removed altogether. They have a 100% chance to spawn in almost every level which forces people who won't stay completely on the main trail to deal with horrible enemies that nobody likes, such as even stronger Vindicators and Icelodgers, in any level. The banner effects are also super unbalanced. Just one mystery banner is way harder than three threat banners. I can deal with massively increased mob stats, but I am completely unable to deal with something like Night Mode. And they expect you to win a level with all six banners for the only probable chance of earning a unique item, too. (trust me, I've tried many times with 3 or 4 and haven't gotten a single unique yet.)

And here's the biggest thing: Daily Trials exist. If you think about the mechanics of it, they're literally the exact same thing except more fun and fair, plus with actually good rewards. Raid Captains don't give you items with exceptionally high power level, and they don't offer exclusive gear either. Daily Trials give both of these things, plus a really high chance to get Unique items on clearing the level.

I definitely agree. The raid captains are making levels like soggy swamp and lower temple impossible to complete on recommended threat level. There should be a button/switch to toggle raid captains, or at the very least lower their spawn rate. The only reason this feature is really useful is if you are on max power level and want to get some items higher than that.
Same! I'm a casual player and I like to play a couple levels below recommended. The raid captains make it really difficult to do levels on my own now
Just use Gong of Weakness and they will die very quick! Altough some of their modifiers is completely unfair like -60% max health, everything basicly 1-2 shots you.
I agree, I've barely been able to level up since they were added
Good idea üëç
Good idea üëç
This could be in the upcoming Nether DLC, because it's made of materials exclusive to the nether.
You can take video on the nentendo switch.  Just hold down the picture button.
Not on Minecraft Dungeons, I have tried multiple times. Playing it right now and can't clip. It says unable to clip in this software

2 things: #1: Mr Man, at this current moment, the video function is disabled in Minecraft dungeons on switch. #2, OP should change the title to ‚ÄúTake video‚Äù instead of ‚Äúclip‚Äù because it‚Äôs slightly confusing in its current state.
This would be great to add in the game! I hope they add this feature
hope they add this
Happened to me too, they need to add this feature.

Doesnt the key usually just run back when you drop it? Or did it get smashed between the traps??? If so then yes add this feature.  Just remember to check back where he spawns because he likes to run back.

You can combine this with the suggestion of making favorite items.

If you favorite an item, you can't salvage it..?
yes, today i salvaged my power 107, legendairy bow by accident, it would be cool to lock items so you can't salvage them by accident.

My young son, who has ASD, accidentally salvaged his favourite ranged weapon today. Of course, this weapon was a unique item with a very specific set of enchantments, that he'd invested a huge amount of time acquiring.

He was bulk salvaging as he'd run up against the inventory limit. Somehow he managed to select the weapon which was equipped whilst he was working on the non-equipped list.

Because he moved slot before he noticed, he was not able to undo the salvage. As you can imagine, he was distraught and spent many hours in tears.

Simply being able to lock or somehow protect your favourite items, even if it's just one of each class (melee, ranged, armour etc) would be brilliant. 

Thank you.
That would be a great idea
Add cannons, pistols and cars to your inventory. Cannons that shoot at the target where the portal turns out. Cannons that break blocks.

We need this. My current way of knowing if it is worth switching weapons is recording my screen with OBS, then cutting the footage to 1 second (during max attack speed/rate) and looking frame by frame how many times it hits for how much damage. This is way too tedious to do regularly and is the main reason why I almost never switch my weapon.

I beg you, take this into consideration. If you don't want to swap out the damage with DPS (which I can understand) then make it an option to switch between the two. Or add as suggested, a meter. (In my opinion, the best way of implementing this feature is to only show DPS when you hit the dummies at Camp by default, and also add the option to change it during gameplay via settings.)

I hope this post explodes as more and more people get the game, right now none of the suggestions are under review :(
Agreed, but the mystery is kinda nice. because it leaves people to choosing what they like instead of just going by metrics like WOW which then limits to only 1 or 2 weapons.

I wish there was multiplayer because I play this game with my brother 99 percent of the time. Idk if you guys are working on multiplayer but I would greatly appreciate it if you at least supported local multiplayer for the tower

There is a huge difficulty spike on round 22. 23-25 are difficult too but then 26-30 feel much more like rounds 1-21. Is this intentional or is it something that can be smoothed out a bit? That Being said, the tower is fun and a good single player challenge. It would be interesting if the tower had a bunch more floors and you could look at a leaderboard in the camp to see who has gone the highest. Lastly, thank you for still putting time into MCD. It‚Äôs one of my all-time favorite games.
In Minecraft dungeons I downloaded the new update cloudy climb and it deleted my best character.
add multiplayer and make the tower change more often. also make the gear for each floor randomize

The Tower is an immensely interesting concept, but the kinks laid in the surface of this feature make it more of a half-put together feature for me than a complete one. Starting with the absurd difficulty spike around floor 22, largely due to the royal guards' knockback and how cramped the space is. Perhaps if this floor was as open as the earlier Highblock Halls floor (around floor 6 iirc) and had less mobs, it would be more of a fair challenge. The 25th floor suffers from this cramped space issue too with the glut of wither skeletons and a ghast in the fray. Balancing issues like these would help this feature a lot.
The roguelike progression system could have the items randomized each time you climb the tower too, and have the Powersmith upgrade 2 items for you, so that you don't sacrifice survivability for more damage? The Gildsmith could give higher gilded enchantments too on Apocalypse.
Lastly, the rewards. They're valuable, but many complain about choosing one of only 3 items, making it nigh impossible to get what you want from here, a simple fix being 6 rewards after completing the tower (while still having to choose only one) while making the tower better than an extra merchant to the camp.
Despite only playing the update for a day and not enjoying it too much, I believe Mojang has laid an earthly foundation for better seasons to come, looking forward to future updates!
TL;DR
loosen floors 22-25, make items more random in the tower and give the vendors more agency.

Here is an idea for the tower: Make it endless ( or at least 100 levels), give players the chance to get one item out of it (or more if they complete the tower). And here comes the good part, let us decide what that item enchants and rarity will be, let the merchants in the tower help us with that task, every 20-25 levels, let us choose an upgrade to add/change from one specific item we brought with us in the tower (for the cost of giving up an upgrade for the next boss). And for god sake, make the tower have a progressive difficulty, I hate when one level kills me twice and I barely escape the third time, but after that, all the levels are a walk in the park. And the main problem: replayability ( make the tower have at least more item combinations, I understand they made it like this so it is challenging, but running it more than 3 times feels like a chore. Give us ways to skip levels, puzzle levels maybe in between the combat levels if u want to skip something, give us chance levels, things that may rely only on luck or skill ( not too many of those, but it can give either a feeling of danger if u get something bad or either courage to go to the combat level next and not skip to the puzzle). The actual tower feels like it was only the work of 3D modeling with someone from the game design who just came in 10 seconds in the room and gave one or two pieces of advice.
How about adding challenges that don't involve killing waves of enemies? Like complex puzzle challenges, or challenges that involve good problem solving skills.

The way you've decided to go with The Tower has shown me that nobody there has any real play time on the game you made. You have decided to put the best rewards in the game on a mode that does not need any gear to complete. What does this do? It makes it so all those rewards you are trying to get mean nothing. They are not required to further get better gear. How did anyone think this was sustainable? This has to be one of the biggest oversights I have ever seen and whoever was behind this decision should be embarrased. Tell me you have no idea what the point of a dungeon crawl is, honestly. Where am I suppose to use all this new over powered gear? In modes that will reward me with gear that is less than what I got in The Tower? The point has become lost. The Tower has made a joke of your game. I am beyond shocked by this.

If you raise the difficulty it will only further destroy things. This tower should have never held such high gear unless it was acheived with gear we had from other sources.

You could have made it so your avatar picks a set up from the gear you currently posses and the tower is "endless". You could have made it so you can pay 500 gold as an option entry fee to have a chance of gilded items and depending on where you died in the tower and the gear you achieved could have meant you get 262 gilded items while still tieing in a need to run Hunts for the entry gold. I mean honestly the botch is so bad. Nobody wants to play as a level one with a common sword again.
HEY, don't offend them like this. Yes 5he tower could have been better, but you need to respect the effort these people put into this mode.
Needs an option so you can play with a friend.

I've ran through the tower many times now, and all the combat has started to make it feel a bit dull. Perhaps a variety of floors could be added that appear throughout the tower to add some variety, instead of it all just being combat. Perhaps a floor where you just have to get from point A to Point B while avoiding an infinite wave of mobs, or a floor with a puzzle/series of puzzles.
I really like it but it takes way to long to go up in rank. I got to floor 15 and I only went up to rank 1 .
would you ever think about making it possible to play old tower variations? i think there would be a lot more replayability if you could play more then just the current tower before it changes
Could you make it that whenever you beat a floor in the tower you get a small bundle of arrows? Whenever I play I keep running out of them.

Love the tower.  I was playing and doing great....then I fell and got stuck on level 14 of 21.  I could not roll out, the enemy could not hit me so I couldn't die, so I had to quit the tower and lose progress.  My suggestion would be to allow respawn or stuck respawn type option like the checkpoint respawn (which didn't work in this case).  I was stuck to the right of the wooden entrance post.  Have video if needed.

 

Great addition to the game keep up the good work.
Multiplayer pleaseeeeeeeee
need multiplayer mode. dungeons one of my main multiplayer games

One idea to improve the tower is letting the player keep ONE piece of their avatars build that helped them through the tower at the end instead of just one random item. The player kinda grows and bonds with the build they make in the tower and its almost like a trophy to keep the one piece that helped you through it. Another debatable idea is to keep the enchantment points collected on the item too so you don't have to spend all of yours once you get it. I can see this being a flaw with people overloading in enchantment points but may help boost using them in ancient hunts or if thats to be avoided then make it so if the player gets rid of that item, none of the tower enchantment points are given back to the player. They just stay with the item. Overall the tower is fun and i play each one but the rewards are lackluster

I really think that, for a certain length of time, the players should be able to return to the place that they died in the tower. (I.e You die 4 times on lvl 23 in the tower, and for 24-72hrs (it should also be random) you can return to lvl 23 with ALL of your stuff)
And also, could you ffs randomize the gear on all of the floors. Like I have done the tower like 5 times, and every time all of the loot is the same, and it's getting boring.

it would be really interesting to see tower floors where you could switch the fighting tone, like puzzles, or even a level where you have to play as a mob. there could even be side areas in which you can earn an additional reward when you complete or fail the tower.

I have a brother that I play with everytime I play a videogame and ever since the tower came out we have rarely played it because it is just boring by yourself so for luminous night please add in some sort of multiplayer or at least make it harder depending on how many players? Thank you for making this game and please take into consideration what I have said.

The Tower has become rather stale since release, so here are some suggestions to add value to the Tower.

1. Randomize the Tower.
The Tower's replayability is by far the worst. No new levels to play after you beat it once, only the same old. Replayability is one of the major reasons why alot of people, like 04AM has stopped playing Dungeons. If every level has randomized sections, for example, there is a bit of Soggy Swamp and Pumpkin Pastures in one level. Randomized mobs, etc. Same with the loot you get every time you finish one level, it should be randomized along with the enchants. This change alone will change the game ALOT.

2. Loot for beating the Tower.
No one will play the Tower if it's to get the same old items. Add Tower-exclusive items themed toward the seasons. Then people will actually put in the effort to play the Tower, because right now it just feels like a chore to play it. Example: Luminous Skeleton Armor.

3. Difficulty.
Now, I don't mean to increase the spawn rate of Creepers. I mean DIFFICULTY. As in a challenge in the Tower, the higher the floor, monsters deal more damage, mini bosses, etc. The last boss should be the hardest of all and should reward you with an exclusive item other than to ones you get for beating the Tower.

Thanks, and I REALLY hope this gets implemented in the next update. I assure you that so many more people will actually play the game, as Minecraft and Minecraft Dungeons are my favorite games of all time.
Good luck.
Pls make Tower changing every time I enter it. Bosses, weapons, armors should be different every time.

With the new seasons, it needs an option to switch between tower seasons to customize your camp and tower experience! Also an option to refresh the tower floors when you get bored of the current layout. (Also better puzzles because even though it's advertised to have them it doesn't)

Frankly, the Tower is my favorite part of Dungeons. It's so fun and rewarding with the random OP loot. Needs multiplayer, but other then that I would say the only nitpick I have is with Luminous Night, the tower floor victory splash text is after all mobs are dead instead of when you go to the next floor. which is fine, but the feel of the splash text feels a little out of place for me. This is more a personal pet peeve for me though, I can't speak for everyone else. 

Again, fantastic addition to the game. Keep up the good work, Mojang!

also please add a story for the tower keepers. or at least some hints.
maybe add a storymode would be nice

The Tower is a nice side mode that is only there to test your skills and knowledge about the mechanics of the game in a simple roguelike adaptation of Minecraft Dungeons. I think the only bad part of the tower is how it was hyped, as players assumed it was going to be WAY bigger than it actually turned out to be.

P.S While the idea of the tower being multiplayer is one many people want, I don't think it would work as well as they would hope for, as all the items would be the same to everyone, which would make it not that diverse in terms of build. And from my experience of both multiplayer and singleplayer, multiplayer tends to be a lot more causal than singleplayer, which is what the tower was made to be for.

However, I do think something a bit like the tower but for multiplayer would be nice. I would recommend instead putting time and effort into making a whole other version of the tower just to support multiplayer, that it goes to a new, maybe even multiplayer only, experience.
I love the tower, I wish I could play it when I'm offline on my Nintendo switch though.

I would say in the future, don't resort to throwing 2 mini bosses together and calling it a boss. Elden Ring has this problem of horribly balanced bosses due to just throwing two bosses/enemies into a room and calling it a new boss. You have to make sure the mechanics of the two don't create impossible or otherwise awful situations.

Floor 21 of the recent Tower update is like this. Illusioner is already an imbalanced mess since he can die super quick or last a long time and deal out absurd damage since you're constantly trying to guess which one is real, and by the time you maybe narrow it down, he clones himself again. On top of that, he can blind you so you're punished even if you guess him right.

The blindness should be an attack that you can see and avoid. And he shouldn't re-clone himself until a few seconds have passed after his clones have been eliminated, so the player is rewarded for narrowing them down instead of feeling at the whims of RNG, since that and the blindness devolves it into RNG.

But also, sticking him with an Enderman is all kinds of awful. I dealt with him, but barely. I had a strategy to nuke him with a Voidstrike + Illager's Bane Anchor using Gong and Power Shaker to make use of his clones, but was punished by missing because I was blinded outside of my control.

Illusioner just isn't a fun boss. He's usually able to be dispatched really easily, but an enemy that's either laughably weak or ridiculously unfair is way off balance.

In general, I feel that the tower gets stale very quickly due to it being the same every time and only rotating every once in a while. I think adding some procedural generation/randomness would vastly improve it. As far as what I mean by that, in my eyes it would include 1. randomly selected or generated levels 2. random bosses and 3. randomly generated or selected upgrades for each level. Additionally, I think the item choices should be balanced so that there is less of a clear choice(maybe some levels only generate normal items or 1 enchantment point where as other generate with unique or even gilded items and 2 enchant points).
refreshes the tower reward using emeralds or gold like restock the merchant inventory
PLEASE ADD MULTIPLAYER ME AND MY FRIEND AND HIS FRIEND BOB ROSS WOULD LOVE MULTIPLAYER TOWER BECAUSE IT WOULD BE BEST AND COOL BETTER BETTREPPER THAN ACTUALLY GAME

There should be unique tower rewards and every time you go into the tower it should be random. Instead of changing it every week just keep the levels in add a randomiser and add more levels as content. Kinda format it how fall guys formats there game.

Please add Artifacts to the pool of loot from The Tower as well as making them Unique or Gilded too (so unique Artifacts are obtainable again, they used to be available in the villager shop but they seemingly got removed in a patch; just make them have a quicker cooldown than rare tier artifacts). This could also be as a dropped bonus from The Tower alongside your normal end loot (like normal levels) meaning you get two drops from The Tower.

Artifacts as of now can only be up to power level 253 (I've never seem a legitimate artifact above this level from pillager banners maxed at 6 on a tier 3 Daily Trial). The Gear power level max is now 268 because of The Tower. Because of this artifacts are behind in power level because they can't be obtained from the Tower. Doesn't help the only unique artifacts are the Vexing Chant and Corrupted Pumpkin which is only from an event.

Speaking of events, Seasonal Trials really need to have gear come from The Tower or be on par with the new power level meta. They can't be the max so they're just pretty to look at and kind of useless end-game. A fix for this would be to make them a cosmetic reskin in the cosmetic tab instead of standalone items and convert ones that exist into their normal variants in our inventories.
I enjoy playing the tower! I think that there needs to be multi-player via drop in though‚Ä¶

It kind of reminds me of a version of archer.io, where you had to start from nothing. Every level you completed you got to choose an upgrade..... and yet I ended up deleting that game for not being able to beat it... also because they did this thing where they ended up changing the entire game and their mechanics, also removed multiplayer which was the best part. But when I couldn't play it, I ignored it. Thats how I feel about tower levels.
I think we should be able to keep all the rewards at the end instead of choosing one.
You should be able to collect emeralds in the tower.
Endersent should spawn as mini-bosses in the tower.

The Tower renders the [Ancient Hunt] obsolete, as far as item levels are concerned. However, I'm not saying [nerf] the item levels in the Tower, but make a way for the Ancient Hunts to be a bit more rewarding when compared to a completed Tower Run.

The Ancient Hunt gold could be used to [juice] the Tower run to include artifacts?

Higher item level artifacts could be introduced in not only the Tower, but Ancient Hunts as well.

There are a vocal few that always have proclamations to [nerf] anything rewarding, such as Tower Chase Items. The entire point of dungeon crawler game features, such as the Tower, are for the allusive chase items. The power level of the items simply match the harder daily missions difficulty (especially with Raid Captains), so these chase items are great addition to Minecraft Dungeons.

Most of the players of Minecraft Dungeons are casual players and don't like to spend our time struggling every single inch of the way, especially once we finally acquire some highly coveted chase items, which are very rare to say the least.

Many times, the difficulty jump from the first 8 or so levels to the first boss chamber is sometimes extreme. Having bosses 1-2 punch you into oblivion isn't fun, especially when there are two bosses chasing you with limited health recovery. There is a fine line between challenging and frustration. Some of the first Tower Boss encounters are frustrating due to the huge jump in difficulty from the previous combat levels.
Tower is super cool idea but we need custom bosses

I have played the tower 5 times in a row now and still haven't gotten armour. I keep getting swords and bows when I really don't need them anymore. I don't like that the only way to get armour from it is to grind, and I have some advice.
1. Give player input on the rewards
2. Balance rewards and make seasonal trial gear easier to get from it.
The difficulty of the tower is ridiculous. I mean, the base game is already brutal, but the tower is even worse

I don''t know if its just me, but sometimes The Tower feels really unbalanced. For example, my friend and I were playing, got to Round 2-3 (I can't remember exactly) and all of a sudden, we got swarmed by a ton of Enderlings, witches etc which seems ridiculous to me.

The multiplayer tower is fun. But the tower itself does not fit in this kind of game and the reward of 263, beyond all other rewards, and I cannot use my items in the tower, therefore the game lost its goal, to improve a character, develop and evolve. We win an item, that cannot be use in the only mode that afford to win an item. To fix at least the bare minimum, all best rewards (like level III missions) should be 263 too. The ideal non-ending game it will be to remove ALL the level cap (something like an "Apocalypse Forever" difficult level, that gives reward mathematically based on the actual power of the player (maybe -5 to +5 from the power the player had when starting a mission)

When I was doing the tower, I was doing amazing. But after defeating the next boss (Specifically the Redstone monstrosity), the game glitched and the door wouldn't open and I had to restart. Could you maybe fix this or make something so this might not happen again?

I feel like their should be better rewards the higher you go up and die. Because I spent about 30-40 minutes on the tower and got to the top floor, then I died by the Illusioner and had the choice between ocelot armor or squid armor, which for me was nothing cause I already have beat the game and gotten a lot of way better stuff. So maybe if it could be a little more balanced please.
